pr_title: [TE] Moved interfaces and datalayer to a new thirdeye-spi module.

timeline.message:
[TE] Moved interfaces and datalayer to a new thirdeye-spi module.

The spi module is intended to be the parent module for all downstream thirdeye consumers. This is part of a multi-phase module refactor.
[TE] Moving constants from DataFrameUtils to DataFrame
[TE] Moved more classes to spi. Removed shallow dependencies
[TE] Fixed all compilation errors in thirdeye-spi

timeline.bodyText: You can use StringUtils from the commons.lang3?
timeline.author: akshayrai
akshayrai

replies.bodyText: primarily to disentangle the code. This class used to depend on a Resource! And this method is used in a single place.
replies.author: suvodeep-pyne

timeline.bodyText: Can you move these classes instead of deleting and recreating a new one?
timeline.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText: This is all done by Intellij. Some of these classes also had code changes which resulted in it showing up as create/delete instead of move. But as such all the classes were git "moved".
replies.author: suvodeep-pyne
